entry.title: Introduce State::PRE_LAUNCHED in BrowserManager
entry.content:
This change adds an additional value in BrowserManager

which describes the state in which Lacros has been

pre-launched at login screen, but it's still waiting

to be unblocked post login.



This makes debugging easier and the state machine less ambiguous.

entry.title: sandbox: Allowlist numbered jpeg dec/enc nodes on CrOS
entry.content:
Right now Chromium sandbox only allows /dev/jpeg-dec and

/dev/jpeg-enc nodes in ChromeOS. However, some devices,

i.e. MT8188 and MT8195 use /dev/jpeg-decN and /dev/jpeg-encN

nodes instead. This change will allowlist these nodes.



Bug: b/259331794

Test: Camera can use HW jpeg-dec in Cherry(8195)

entry.title: Modernize chrome://gpu backend, remove CallJavascriptFunctionUnsafe.
entry.content:
Use ResolveJavascriptCallback/sendWithPromise and

FireWebUIListener/addWebUiListener pairs to send data between backend

and frontend, removing the old and deprecated way of calling JS

methods directly from C++ by name, via CallJavascriptFunctionUnsafe. See

[1] for more details.



As part of these simplifications, removing a bespoke chrome.send('callAsync', ...) callback mechanism, in favor of the

better and standardized sendWithPromise() approach.



This is in preparation of migrating chrome://gpu frontend to TypeScript.



[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/webui_explainer.md#pre_mojo-alternative_chrome_send_webuimessagehandler



Bug: 1002798

Change-Id: I7c59a63aee499664036a778373c0de35deaadfcc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4505369

Reviewed-by: Zhenyao Mo

entry.title: flags: improve error reporting for tests
entry.content:
The AboutFlagsTest that reports when flags are out of order does so by

telling the person running the test (the developer) that a flag is in

the wrong place. It should instead tell them what the right place for

the flag is, so that they can move it there.



This change:

* Modifies EnsureFlagsAreListedInAlphabeticalOrder() to report

out-of-order flags as described above

* Removes the FlagFile type and uses of it from this test helper - it

does not add any value over simply having constants to represent the

filenames and passing those around

* Makes ReadFileContentsAsJSON() CHECK on invalid JSON instead of

DCHECKing



Fixed: 1432086

Change-Id: I57248b70364a4100a1ce9c50ecc4f0e4e8e0f12d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4500338

entry.title: Add a persistent back button toolbar for automotive
entry.content:
This is accomplished using a ThemeOverlay that adds a support action bar for most activities, and using a Toolbar view for activities that already use their own support action bar



Light mode screenshots

* Full screen YouTube: https://hsv.googleplex.com/4545896587984896

* Generic web page: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6240046060404736

* First run activity: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6733395506757632

* Settings activity: https://hsv.googleplex.com/4645671496843264



Dark mode screenshots

* Full screen YouTube: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6734269666820096

* Generic web page: https://hsv.googleplex.com/6087288946688000

* First run activity: https://hsv.googleplex.com/4593149885284352

* Settings activity: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5096553967517696



Video example of back button: https://screencast.googleplex.com/cast/NTAyNDM3MTQyMTc0MTA1Nnw4NWNkOTM5YS0zMg



Note, there are a couple related bugs still:

* Full screen toast text needs to be changed/removed: https://hsv.googleplex.com/5383216165814272, http://crbug/1440455

* The black space in YouTube full screen in automotive seems to be off (should be more at the bottom and less at the top)

* Activities that look like Dialogs have the toolbar disabled for now (see follow ups)



Follow ups:

* Follow up on Activities that don't extend ChromeBaseAppCompatActivity

* Follow up on Activities that use their own ActionBar

* Follow up on all Activities that resemble Dialogs (and see if we can mimic FirstRunActivity to get toolbar)

* Follow up on DialogFragments (ex: QrCodeDialog) that need the toolbar

* Investigate base auto layout approach, ex: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4507190

* Follow up on breaking auto trybot tests: http://crbug/1443006

This CL implements the Linux breakpad handler, this is

similar to the Windows breakpad handler except that

and metadata generation will be done within the host

process. In a follow-up CL I will add a crash dump

upload utility that will be owned by the

chrome-remote-desktop service.

entry.title: Delay pending tasks to ensure we do not spin cpu
entry.content:
If install fails as busy, we immediately enqueue the request and run it

again. In a bad case, this can cause us to dos update-engine, and spin

cpu. This adds a 3s delay before running a pending request.

entry.title: Added the mute state for audio sliders
entry.content:
Previous mute behavior: The icon on the slider is actually an ImageView.

It's not actionable. If the user clicks/taps the icon, it's the slider

that handles the event, and the slider goes to 0 and becomes muted.

Users can also drag the slider to the far left/press volume down key/

press mute key to mute the slider.



Current mute behavior: After this change, the icon becomes an

IconButton. If the user clicks/taps the icon, the slider becomes muted

while preserving the current level. Other mute behavior remains the

same.



1)Provided Style::kDefaultMuted and Style::kRadioActiveMuted for Quick

Settings Slider.

2)Updated the main page volume slider to have the mute state.

3)Updated the audio subpage volume and mic sliders to have the mute

state.

4)Changed the unit test for volume slider mute behavior.

5)Updated the font for the live caption label and slider labels.



Screenshots:

Volume slider in the main page:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AwD9XZsgAYduHhH

Interaction:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7Zvu6efZxR6oCgY



Sliders in the audio subpage:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8wpt9zM6Z7VLa6F

Interaction:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3QCWg6nznGyviWS



Live caption and slider label font update:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/64vBPfHtdFmGYeK

entry.title: Use EXPECT_CALL properly in audio_context_manager_browsertest.cc
entry.content:
The documentation says "EXPECT_CALL must precede any code that

exercises the mock object." but this test has EXPECT_CALL in locations

after code that exercises the mock object. Put the expectations

immediately after the mock object declaration instead.



This may be the source of flakiness in this test. I'm not going to

re-enable the test in this CL, since we should wait until the flake

portal shows the flakiness is resolved.

entry.title: [a11y] Newline generated in list item accessible name when <div> inside
entry.content:
This CL fixes a bug where a newline was being generated for a
  • 's

    accessible name in AXRange::GetText under the following tree structure:







    1. Hello







    2. World







    Actual result for the text range was:



    "1.

    hello

    2. world"



    Expected result was:

    "1. hello

    2. world



    We accomplish this by adding a check inside AXRange::GetText to not

    add a newline character after a kListMarker, unless specified by


    element.

entry.title: [fuchsia] Set abi_revision in resolved Components
entry.content:
Report the Fuchsia platform ABI revision targeted by resolved Cast

components as that with which the Cast resolver implementation was

built. This will be used in future to ensure that components outside

the compatibility window of the platform build on which they are run

can be flagged as potentially incompatible, or prevented from launching.



Several APIs used by Cast components are actually passed-through to the

web_instance.cm in which the component's web content is hosted, such as

the `fuchsia.logger.LogSink` to which its script output is routed. It is

assumed that the platform ABI targeted by the web_instance.cm will also

be verified, and reported, so that that need not be reflected in the

revision reported by the Cast Resolver.



Bug: fuchsia:119314

Change-Id: I4cea755b0ba61bd1a759d9b16f6345a71849aab0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4507148

Commit-Queue: Wez

entry.title: [UIA] Don't expose the Toggle pattern with the ExpandCollapse one
entry.content:
The UIA documentation [1] and Accessibility Insights [2] seem to

indicate that the Toggle control pattern should not be exposed when the

ExpandCollapse control pattern is already exposed for a button.



This CL implements this requirement.



[1]: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/winauto/uiauto-supportbuttoncontroltype#required-control-patterns

[2] https://github.com/microsoft/axe-windows/blob/main/src/Rules/Library/ButtonInvokeAndExpandeCollapsePatterns.cs



Fixed: 1422494

entry.title: [Tab Model] Add tab from undo before selecting
entry.content:
On undoing a tab closure the TabObserver event sequence is currently

* didSelectTab (if no tab was previously valid)

* tabClosureUndone



This order sort of makes sense except the only way for a TabObserver

to know a tab was restored is via tabClosureUndone. As such, the

selection event occurs before the TabObserver knows the tab was

re-created this leads to an ordering inversion that is particularly

hard to reason about and handle in the TabModelFilter and tab_ui/

layers.



Invert this sequencing so that the logic is

* mIndex is set if applicable - the TabModel is still in a "valid state"

getCurrentTab*() works as usual if the TabObserver needs it.

* tabClosureUndone fires - observers know the tab was added.

* didSelectTab fires if applicable - observers with their own versions

of the TabModel can correctly handle the selection state updates.



This should allow for reversing this change in a follow-up:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/1552281



While checking this, it also appears that UndoRefocusHelper is

registered really early and for this re-ordering to not break in that

observer it needs to be initialized after the TabModelFilter as it calls

setIndex inside of tabClosureUndone.



Bug: 1440864

Change-Id: I5c6ee8eedcefac1a1ea583b9410e50d1cd3447fa

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4496489

entry.title: Rename blink::Color::FloatAlpha() to Alpha()
entry.content:
As part of the CSS Color 4/5 efforts, blink::Colors now store floats

as color channels and alpha. FloatAlpha is thus a simple getter and

per the style guide should be called "Alpha()".



There was a Color::Alpha() that returned an integer version of

alpha in the range [0,255]. To be super clear, the name of that function

was changed to GetAlphaAsInteger() in https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4494556.



GetAlphaAsInteger is being used in a lot of places where IsTransparent

would be more appropriate. This will be addressed in a future CL.

entry.title: Cannot always re-use a layout result with space shortage.
entry.content:
If a layout result has space shortage stored, we cannot re-use it if the

fragmentation line moves. If the space shortage was very low, we'd keep

on stretching the columns by this tiny amount, then retry and repeat

until finally finding a good column block-size, after many attempts.



This makes

perf_tests/layout/multicol/balance-list-items-with-tall-marker.html

about 11 times faster, and the new test

balance-tables-with-break-inside-avoidance.html becomes about 50 times

faster.



The new call to NGLayoutResult::MinimalSpaceShortage() from

LayoutBox::CachedLayoutResult() may be checked in the initial column

balancing pass, so we now need to make sure that that function also

behaves correctly in that pass. NGLayoutResult has a data union for

minimal space shortage and tallest unbreakable block-size. Make sure

that TallestUnbreakableBlockSize() also behaves correctly in non-

initial column balancing passes, while we're at it, for good measure.



Bug: 1371575

Change-Id: I230f743c55d3c392a7126dc1580de4b49d0bd34c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4512177

entry.title: Enable more bluetooth extension APIs for Lacros.
entry.content:
Enables the bluetoothPrivate and bluetoothLowEnergy extension APIs for

Lacros. Previously these were only enabled for the Ash browser

(extensions platform = "chromeos").



Enables the BluetoothLowEnergyApiTest.* and BluetoothPrivateApiTest.*

tests which now pass.



Also enables the feedbackPrivate.readLogSource extension API on Lacros. This seems to be not covered by a test but I believe should not differ between the Ash Browser and Lacros. This "API is restricted to allowlisted extensions and WebUI." Currently WebUI on ChromeOS is still run in the Ash browser which is probably why we have not noticed, but this is likely to change when these use-cases are converted to Lacros.

entry.title: Invalidate the ongoing calculation when CacheCounter is restarted on iOS
entry.content:
The Desktop CacheCounter already does this.



CacheCounter lives on the UI thread, but the calculation takes place

on the IO thread. If the counter is restarted multiple times,

CacheCounter receives multiple callbacks from the IO thread, while it

only expects one.



Callbacks to return the counting result in an "IDLE" state then hit

a NOTREACHED().



Bug: 1434125

entry.title: Storage Quota: evict more buckets at once.
entry.content:
Instead of just evicting one bucket at a time before re-calculating

eviction needs, evict as many bucket as it should take to clear up

sufficient space.



The most dangerous part of this change is that Chrome will now clear

buckets based on their QuotaClient-reported usage, while the process

is still triggered by OS-reported disk space usge. This could mean

that more buckets are deleted than necessary if some QuotaClients

under-report usage.



We should keep a close eye on histograms such as

* Quota.EvictedBytesPerRound

* Quota.NumberOfEvictedBucketsPerRound



Bug: 1382847



Change-Id: I117570ef7d30991f245c095aa99c731cac3aaf4d

entry.title: Fix ProcessMemoryMetricsEmitterTest.RendererBuildId for Linux official
entry.content:
RendererBuildId has been failing our official linux tests for a while.

See https://ci.chromium.org/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux64-tests.

It makes us harder to compare the builder with pre-branching tests,

as all builds are red.



Digging into the error, it seems main_module_data.path.data() might be

a relative path for browser test [1], while region->mapped_file

are in absolute path. As they are not matched in string, memory_instrumentation fails to attach the build id from main module

to region.



This CL keeps main_module_data.path an absolute path.



[1] https://chrome-swarming.appspot.com/task?id=62062b1bbfaad811



BUG=1345868

TEST=out/Default/browser_tests



Change-Id: I4f543f1932fce4b40c8b4ea8adcd6f7bdce021ed

entry.title: [QuickStart] Created common logic for handling decoder errors
entry.content:
The goal of this change is to centralize handling decoder errors, and

express them in a common way.



With this change, Wifi Credentials parsing is now returned through

a callback with two parameters - an optional pointer to the data, and

and optional enum for an error. Future CLs will update all other

QuickStartDecoder endpoints to match this exactly.



Parsing is now done through DecodeData. DecodeData not only calls into

QuickStartDecoder, but checks the return values for sanity. If an error

code is returned, empty data is returned. If not, we

return the data through the success callback.



Future CLs will explore moving more error handling into this common method



This approach gives the following benefits:

* Less error prone error handling. Provided the decoder is only called

through this method, we can guarantee that the connection handles errors

the same regardless of what is parsed

* Simplified debugging - errors now all follow the same path, making

it way easier to figure out what happens in the error case.

* Simplified code - although some templates are used, these are commented and limited in usage.



Test: Updated Existing Tests



Bug: b/280330703

entry.title: Fix the order of CE upgrades in cloneContents and extractContents
entry.content:
Both were not cloning nodes in tree order, which they should do, per

the spec:



https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/#concept-range-extract



See an equivalent fix on WebKit:



https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/WebKit/WebKit/-/commit/fa5a06a66c96bc6864e684d9f9f07b115f39c60e?visible=4



This is a slightly more hacky approach that clones the nodes first

and then leaves the traversal in the same order. But it seems to pass

all of the custom elements tests, so perhaps ok.

entry.title: gfx::ColorTransform: Separate static vs runtime parameters
entry.content:
Some entries in gfx::ColorTransform::Options are baked into the

resulting SkShader's source, while some correspond to uniforms. The

distinction isn't clear, and this is often a source of bugs (see, e.g,

crbug.com/1418007).



Split off RuntimeOptions from Options. Put the parameter

sdr_max_luminance_nits in both of these structures because it affects

both the shader source and the uniforms. A follow up patch will move

it to only be in the uniforms.



Change gfx::ColorTransform::GetSkShaderUniforms to no longer be a

static function, and, in gfx::ColorConversionSkFilterCache, cache the

gfx::ColorTransform (so that GetSkShaderUniforms can be called on it).



Add gfx::ColorTransform::RuntimeOptions to the Transform and

GetSkShaderUniforms functions, as well as the related functions in

the internal ColorTransformStep.



Bug: 1442884

Change-Id: I9378c5a593a52fdb01d1a8f0c8e6ac96ee3b3a4b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4509280

entry.title: Auto-attach tab targets to browser target if selected by filter
entry.content:
- force WebContentsDevToolsAgentHost creation when WC is created,

same as we do for RFDTAH;

- deal with the consequences of the above, as we now created WCDTAH

in cases we previously haven't and this caused some invariants

to become obsolete;

- attach Tabs in Browser's auto-attacher (and let filters in the

Target handler decide if it actually has to be attached)

- return an error when a filter on browser-level Target handler

allows both Tab and Frame targets;

- ensure navigation throttle is created for sessions attached to the

tab target;

- support Runtime.runIfWaitingForDebugger for Tab targets (and

gracefully handle the fact that actual Runtime agent is absent).

entry.title: Use initial_preferences in mini_installer
entry.content:
We mentioned in M101 release notes that from M107

master_preferences would be renamed to initial_preferences. However,

there are some work left in the Windows installer.



1) When `CopyPreferenceFileForFirstRun`, always use

initial_preferences as target path.

2) When read configuration for shortcut creation, use

inital_preferences if available. And keep master_preferences as

fallback.

3) Unit test function name update.



Also create a util initial_preferences loading function that is shared

between installer and FRE.



M101 release notes:

https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/10314655?sjid=12815557169536529241-NA#101&zippy=%2Cchrome

entry.title: Use more specific base::Value type in ListPolicyHandler
entry.content:
We always expect the value to be a List, so using the `List` type

helps with readability and avoids extra type checks.



For `CheckAndGetList`, use an `absl::optional` reference so we can

handle all three possibilities:

1. `filtered_list` is missing on input and output

2. `filtered_list` is present on input, but cleared (value is empty)

3. `filtered_list` is present on input and output



Case (2) used to be handled by leaving the `base::Value` pointer

unassigned, so it stayed empty. Now we represent that with an emptied

`absl::optional`.



Change-Id: Ie34a57236b2689c965820beb4bfcd068e5803799

entry.title: ContentSettings: Fix histogram value mapping
entry.content:
Modernize ContentSetting to histogram value mapping. Use FixedFlatMap

instead of a sorted array.

This change uncovered a few missing values that are added to the bottom

of the mapping. It also uncovered that Cookies is mapped as 0, which

is not supported by LinearHistogram, so it is assigned a new value.

The way num_values was calculated and used to indicate the max value of

a LinearHistogram was also incorrect since the mapping had multiple

gaps.

entry.title: Implement a gauge chart component on the high efficiency dialog
entry.content:
Screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7HqfVSgF637Tvc8



Previously we just rendered the size of the savings and a label

below that. Now we render a gauge style chart that finds which of

four buckets the memory savings falls into and then fills the gauge up to that point.



Will follow up with UX on exact font sizes, colors, and line widths.

Additional testing and work will also be done to ensure dark mode/

theme compatibility and a11y.

entry.title: Anchored Nudge Data struct
entry.content:
Add AnchoredNudgeData struct to pass and store AnchoredNudge parameters

between the feature code, manager and the view.



Also add a base catalog enum for AnchoredNudge objects which will be

used to record general metrics for all implemented nudges.
